Noah Schwadron info

This Magazine is for Snails

2023
editorial

A journal of art and ecology for people who live slowly and intentionally. The design is inspired by an imagined point of view of a snail traversing the leaves of a healthy vegetable garden, while also taking typographic cues from homely web 1.0 gardening blogs (where all the best gardening tips come from).

1/

Muriel Cooper

2023
exhibition

A proposed exhibition of the pioneering digital designerâ€™s career. Many ideas central to her work are on display in her 3D typography and information landscape prototypes, so I referenced them heavily in the design of the space. Titles are skewed in abstract 3D space, the wall layouts give a sense of depth and motion, and the exhibition allows for a non-linear experience of the content.

1/

There's One Climate Narrative We Need To Debunk

2023
code, illustration

A generative & interactive illustration for Bloomberg Businessweek. Climate researchers are rather absurdly being accused of sensationalizing their findings, so I wanted the viewer to have the absurd experience of sensationalizing the environment.

+ Live Site

1/

Click Shirt

2022
apparel, silkscreen

I once had a dream that I found a Click promo t-shirt at a thrift store. Upset that it was only a dream, I made that shirt into a beautiful reality.

1/

BioMuseo Generative Identity

2022
identity, code

Biomuseo is a museum in Panama dedicated to exploring the natural history of the country. For numerous reasons, the concept of biodiversity is central to that story. The logo visually reflects the museumâ€™s iconic architecture, and its generative nature reflects their focus on biodiversity.

1/

First Things First

2022
editorial

For AIGAâ€™s manifesto calling for designers to prioritize cultural and functional work over consumeristic projects, I wanted to show their seriousness, but also convey momentum and hope.
